net.kuujo.vertigo.output

Interface Channel


  • public interface Channel
    A uni-directional communication channel. A channel represents a set of connections represented by a single output. When a message is emitted from a component, the message is published to all component channels. Within each channel, the channel selects the appropriate Connection to which to publish the message and validates that the target component is interested in receiving the message.
    Author:
    Jordan Halterman

      • id

        Gets the channel identifier.

        Removes a connection from the channel.

      • containsConnection

        boolean containsConnection(String address)
        Returns a boolean indicating whether the channel contains a connection by address.
        Parameters:
        address - The connection address.
        Returns:
        A boolean indicating whether the channel contains a connection at that address.

      • getConnection

        Connection getConnection(String address)
        Returns a connection by address.
        Parameters:
        address - The connection address.
        Returns:
        A connection instance or null if the connection doesn't exist.

      • publish

        List<MessageId> publish(JsonMessage message)
        Publishes a message to the channel.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to publish to the channel.
        Returns:
        A list of written message identifiers.
